meanings.definition: A loop of thread or yarn used to join fabric.
meanings.sent1: She carefully placed a small stitch on the torn shirt.
meanings.sent2: The tailor sewed the dress with neat stitches.
meanings.sent3: The stitch on the hem of the dress decided to take a break.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like stitches, holding the group together.
meanings.sent5: The colorful stitch stood out against the plain fabric.

meanings.definition: A sudden sharp pain in the side.
meanings.sent1: After running, he felt a sharp stitch in his side.
meanings.sent2: The stitch in her side made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent3: The stitch in his side felt like a tiny elf poking him.
meanings.sent4: The stitch in her side was a reminder of her intense workout.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected stitch caught her by surprise during the race.

meanings.definition: A single movement of a needle in sewing.
meanings.sent1: With each stitch, the fabric came together beautifully.
meanings.sent2: She practiced her stitching to make perfect seams.
meanings.sent3: The stitch in the needle felt like a dance with the fabric.
meanings.sent4: Her stitching was so precise, it was like magic.
meanings.sent5: The stitch in time saved her from a wardrobe malfunction.
